results.title: Hair
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Lester Persky, Michael Butler and Milos Forman
results.brief_description: Despite the sceptics, Milos Forman transformed the ultimate “tribal rock musical” of the 1960’s into an exuberant film experience. The score is performed in a variety of locations including table tops, Central Park, Wall Street and in march formation aboard a plane heading for Vietnam. “Hair” is not just a nostalgic look at the ‘60’s and “The Age of Aquarius”, but the ideals it espouses about peace, individual freedom, joy and love are just as passionate and relevant today, as they were shocking and radical at the time of America’s involvement in Vietnam. Gerome Ragni and James Rado worked on this film production of their original stageplay.

results.title: Hail Mary = Je Vous salue Marie
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Television Romande, Channel 4 and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: This amazingly moving, funny yet disturbing, richly human film has aroused passionate feelings right around the world. Mary, the young daughter of a petrol station owner who is just beginning to discover womanhood, and her taxi driver, Joseph, try to grapple with her unexplained pregnancy.

results.title: Gypsy
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Mervyn LeRoy and Orry-Kelly
results.brief_description: Gypsy Rose Lee, burlesque Queen of renown, was driven to stardom much less by her own ambition, than by the ruthless determination of her mother. As the stereotypical domineering “stage mother”, Rosalind Russell’s performance is superb, while Karl Malden as her long-suffering but loyal lover also gives a fine performance. While the references to striptease are undeniably fleeting, Natalie Wood as Gypsy Rose Lee is creditable, but it is her vulnerability rather than her sex appeal which comes to the fore. Stephen Sondheim’s lyrics and Julie Styne’s score makes this a musical delight.

results.title: Guys and dolls
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn Productions, Samuel Goldwyn and Joseph L Mankiewicz
results.brief_description: Adapted from a short story by Damon Runyan about a pair of ne’er to do gamblers trying to snare a jackpot amidst the clutter of Times Square as well as the affections of two women. The excellent score by Frank Loesser includes “Luck be a lady”, “If I were a bell” and Stubby Kaye’s show stopper “Sitdown, you’re rocking the boat.” Choreographer Michale Kidd brought the dances full of flash and vitality to the screen. Starring Marlon Brando, Frank Sinatra, Jean Simmons and Vivian Blaine.

results.title: Gunga Din
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures and George Stevens
results.brief_description: Gunga Din is rowdy, heroic, exciting, funny and steeped in the romantic tradition of moviemaking. A sergeant in the British army, Cutter is a restless treasure-seeker likely to get everyone into trouble; MacChesney is a typically gruff and aggressive NCO always ready for a fight; and Ballantine is a gentleman who thinks he wants to leave the army to marry his one true love. Gunga Din is an Indian water carrier, a friend in need to the trouble-making trio - a simple man who is destined to become a hero. Based on the poem by Rudyard Kipling the film stars Cary Grant, Victor McLaglen, Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. and Joan Fontaine.

results.title: Gunfight at the O.K. Corral
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Hal Wallis and John Sturges
results.brief_description: Considered to be one of the best western films ever made, director John Sturges explores the relationship between two of the west’s most celebrated legends - Wyatt Earp (Burt Lancaster) and Doc Holliday (Kirk Douglas). Earp is a U.S. Marshal in Dodge City and Holliday a dentist - turned gambler - who knows how to handle a gun. When Earp saves Holliday from mob violence, the foes become friends and join forces to rid the west of the lawless Clanton gang. It all leads up to the legendary Gunfight at the O.K. Corral. Screenplay by Leon Uris. Featuring a small appearance by a very young Dennis Hopper.

results.title: Guess who's coming to dinner?
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn and Spencer Tracy portray the proud parents of a young lady who’s about to bring home the man she wants to marry. They’ve heard he’s handsome and full of career prospects but when they discover that he’s black they find out that they’re not as broadminded as they thought. Sidney Poitier is the son-in-law elect in this examination of prejudice and social manners.

results.title: Guarding Tess
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Channel, Ned Tanen, Nancy Graham Tanen and Hugh Wilson
results.brief_description: Tess Carlisle (Shirley MacLaine) is the widow of a former president of the United States who has become a national treasure. Doug Chesnic (Nicolas Cage) is the secret security agent that is hired to ensure that she stays safe and out of trouble. Doug, accustomed to assignments that involve danger and excitement, dreads his mundane task and he finds Tess patronising, eccentric, rude, demanding and acerbic. Typically within the odd-couple formula, these two adversaries have to reach a truce, which for Doug means trying to maintain his exacting standards despite the unpredictable nature of Tess’ whims. An attempt on Tess’ life and a mystery illness provide narrative developments, but it is mostly the shenanigans and intricacies of the secret service operatives that keep the film interesting. “Guarding Tess” drifts toward melodrama and tends to exude a cloying sentimentality, but it also contains a certain charm due to the performances of Cage and MacLaine. Directed by Hugh Wilson (The First wives club, Dudley do right).

results.title: Groundhog Day
results.creator_credit: Trevor Albert, Columbia Pictures and Harold Ramis
results.brief_description: Have you ever had one of those days where you wished you could relive the day and do things differently? Wise cracking weatherman Phil, (Bill Murray) is living the same day over and over. It all begins when he is sent with other crew members to Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania to cover the annual Groundhog Day Festival; the one day of the year when the seasons weather forecast is decided by an animal. Initially they are to move out after the report but a snow storm leaves them snowbound. With no tomorrow and no consequences to face, Phil is eager to explore every fantasy and possibility, and he does. Trying to enamour himself to the producer Rita, (Andie MacDowall) proves harder than he thought, no matter how long he has to try. Also starring Chris Elliot, Brian Doyle-Murray and Stephen Tobolowsky.

results.title: Grosse Pointe blank
results.creator_credit: Buena Vista, Susan Arnold, Roger Birnbaum, Donna Roth and George Armitage
results.brief_description: Hilariously black romantic comedy about a hit man who returns to his home town and attends his high school reunion. Encountering a former flame, who he unceremoniously jilted several years earlier, Martin is caught between his dark past (that has followed him home) and his desire for something new with Debbie. Top cast includes John and Joan Cusack, Alarn Arkin, Minnie Driver and Dan Ackroyd.
